metadata.dc:author: Carabias Hernández, Alberto
Limones Esteban, Manuel
Rodríguez Ortega, María
Montano Navarro, Enrique
Monereo Alonso, Alfonso
Rodríguez Barbero, José María
metadata.dc:description: We present a case of obstructive jaundice due to duodenal amyloidosis presenting as a bulbar pseudotumor (amyloidoma). The duodenal and biliary obstruction were treated by double bypass, hepatojejunostomy and gastroenterostomy. Our case suggests that surgical palliative treatment may be effective, and that anastomosis is probably safe, allowing the patient a good quality of life.
metadata.dc:title: Ictericia obstructiva. Inicio clínico de una amiloidosis duodenal tratada quirúrgicamente.
[Obstructive jaundice caused by duodenal amyloidosis succesfully treated with surgery].
